tracks.title: Weekday Projects — Data Analysis
tracks.description: A more structured and business-oriented approach. Here, I explore how human decisions and business processes are reflected in data.

projects.name: Credit Default Risk Prediction
projects.explored: Translating machine learning probabilities into Net Protected Value, proving how a transparent linear model can outperform complex algorithms in protecting actual business capital.
projects.curiosity: How do we accurately identify high-risk borrowers before the funds ever leave the bank?
projects.tools: Python, Logistic Regression, XGBoost, GridSearchCV, Cost-Benefit Analysis

projects.name: Customer Churn Prediction
projects.explored: Mapping the messy reality of e-commerce churn by analyzing how a machine learning model weighs shipping logistics and late deliveries.
projects.curiosity: Is customer loyalty a simple equation of fast shipping and low costs, or is human behavior too contradictory to predict?
projects.tools: Python, Random Forest Classifier, SHAP Values, SQL

tracks.title: Weekend Projects — Creative Machine Learning
tracks.description: A curiosity-driven exploration space. These projects often start from simple technical questions or playful experiments that evolve into deeper investigations.

projects.name: The Anatomy of Attention
projects.explored: Manually dissecting the math behind BERT's Multi-Head Attention to understand how it calculates context, and building a minimalist UI to map it out.
projects.curiosity: How does a machine actually know which words matter in a sentence?
projects.tools: Python, PyTorch, FastAPI, Vanilla JS, SVG

projects.name: Q-Learning Maze Experiment
projects.explored: Training an AI agent to navigate a maze using reinforcement learning.
projects.curiosity: Can an AI agent learn to solve problems through trial and error without being explicitly programmed for every step?

tracks.title: Academic & Explorations
tracks.description: Projects that don't fit into my weekday or weekend structure. Sometimes academic, sometimes experimental — still part of the journey.

projects.name: Neural Network in Minecraft
projects.explored: Implementing a trained MNIST neural network in Minecraft using redstone logic with integer-quantized weights.
projects.curiosity: Can AI exist in an environment never meant for machine learning?
projects.tools: Python, Quantization, Two's Complement, L1 Regularization, Binary Logic
